unnormalised: ## Dhingana Done Right: My Love-Hate Relationship with Music Streaming
normalised: ## Dhingana Done Right: My Love-Hate Relationship with Music Streaming

unnormalised: Remember Dhingana? Back in the day, that was the OG Bollywood music streaming service. Before Gaana, before Spotify even dreamt of setting foot near Marine Drive, Dhingana ruled! And then, like a Raj Kapoor film with a tragic ending, it vanished. Poof! Gone. Leaving us all scrambling back to limewire (shudder).
normalised: Remember Dhingana? Back in the day, that was the O G Bollywood music streaming service. Before Gaana, before Spotify even dreamt of setting foot near Marine Drive, Dhingana ruled! And then, like a Raj Kapoor film with a tragic ending, it vanished. Poof! Gone. Leaving us all scrambling back to limewire (shudder).

unnormalised: Now, we're swimming in a sea of music streaming options. You've got your Spotifys, your Apples, your Gaana-s and Saavns. It’s like a Bollywood shaadi buffet - so much choice, you end up piling everything onto one plate and regretting it later.
normalised: Now, we're swimming in a sea of music streaming options. You've got your Spotifys, your Apples, your Gaana-s and Saavns. It’s like a Bollywood shaadi buffet - so much choice, you end up piling everything onto one plate and regretting it later.

unnormalised: Honestly, the sheer volume of music is both a blessing and a curse. I mean, I can finally listen to that obscure RD Burman track from the 70s I only heard once on All India Radio. Amazing! But then I spend 45 minutes scrolling, only to end up listening to "Chaiyya Chaiyya" for the millionth time. Thanks, algorithms. You know me so well.
normalised: Honestly, the sheer volume of music is both a blessing and a curse. I mean, I can finally listen to that obscure R D Burman track from the seventies I only heard once on All India Radio. Amazing! But then I spend forty five minutes scrolling, only to end up listening to "Chaiyya Chaiyya" for the millionth time. Thanks, algorithms. You know me so well.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the "Discover Weekly" playlists. Mine usually features a bizarre mix of hardcore death metal (which I've never listened to) and elevator music. I suspect my phone is judging my actual music taste (which, admittedly, includes a LOT of 90s Bollywood).
normalised: And don't even get me started on the "Discover Weekly" playlists. Mine usually features a bizarre mix of hardcore death metal (which I've never listened to) and elevator music. I suspect my phone is judging my actual music taste (which, admittedly, includes a L O T of nineties Bollywood).

unnormalised: The constant battle between wanting to support artists (Rs. 129 a month seems reasonable, right?) and wanting to just pirate everything like it's 1999 is REAL. My inner auntyji is constantly screaming "Paisa vasool!" at me.
normalised: The constant battle between wanting to support artists (rupee one hundred and twenty nine a month seems reasonable, right?) and wanting to just pirate everything like it's nineteen ninety nine is R E A L. My inner auntyji is constantly screaming "Paisa vasool!" at me.

unnormalised: Plus, the anxiety of not having downloaded enough songs for that 200 km road trip to Lonavala is a whole other level of existential dread. Will I be stuck listening to static the whole way? Will my phone explode from overuse? The suspense is killing me!
normalised: Plus, the anxiety of not having downloaded enough songs for that two hundred kilometer road trip to Lonavala is a whole other level of existential dread. Will I be stuck listening to static the whole way? Will my phone explode from overuse? The suspense is killing me!

unnormalised: But hey, at least now I don't have to painstakingly create mixtapes anymore. Though, those were the days... remember labeling each cassette with a Bic pen? Good times!
normalised: But hey, at least now I don't have to painstakingly create mixtapes anymore. Though, those were the days... remember labeling each cassette with a Bic pen? Good times!

unnormalised: So, here’s to music streaming: a chaotic, beautiful, sometimes frustrating, and ultimately essential part of modern life. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to fight the algorithm and find that perfect, undiscovered gem. Wish me luck!
normalised: So, here’s to music streaming: a chaotic, beautiful, sometimes frustrating, and ultimately essential part of modern life. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm off to fight the algorithm and find that perfect, undiscovered gem. Wish me luck!
